b'One of the challenges with making a biotech therapy is that cells are both extremely small and incredibly complex. A lot of people, time, and equipment are needed to engineer cells that can make new medicines.

This is where digital cell biology comes in. Invented by Berkeley Lights and developed with input from Amgen, this emerging technology uses light to manipulate single living cells without damaging them and allows researchers to actually see cells in action and gain more information in a much faster way.

It\xe2\x80\x99s a new scientific field that\xe2\x80\x99s opening up exciting possibilities for biotech research.

[Click link in bio to learn more] #AmgenScience #WeAreBiotech'

b'More than ever, science and technology are vital for tackling the many challenges we\xe2\x80\x99re facing in our community\xe2\x80\x94and the world. Now, with a renewed focus on research, evidence, and innovation, we look forward to working together toward our common goals.

Let\xe2\x80\x99s celebrate the expertise and talent of scientists and all those dedicated to advancing knowledge. At Amgen we\xe2\x80\x99re proud of our team and the work we do to help improve lives everywhere.

[Click link in bio to learn more]

#AmgenScience #WeAreBiotech'

b'Multispecific drugs = the start of a new era. :folded_hands::raising_hands: There have been 3 major waves of innovation in drug discovery to date:

:white_heavy_check_mark: The introduction of aspirin started the first wave\xe2\x80\x94medicines with well-defined chemical structures but unknown biology.

:white_heavy_check_mark: Wave 2 introduced rational drug design\xe2\x80\x94specific compounds aimed at specific molecular targets that play a role in disease.

:white_heavy_check_mark: In wave 3, the biotechnology revolution, recombinant DNA technology allowed us to go beyond chemical compounds and design medicines based on the proteins and other large molecules that govern biology.

:bright_button: We\xe2\x80\x99re now at the start of the fourth wave, which will advance our concept of how drugs can work. The age of multispecific drugs is beginning.\xc2\xa0 Read more at the link in bio under, \xe2\x80\x9cA Sea of Change in Drug Design\xe2\x80\x9d. #wearebiotech #amgenscience :dna::microscope::petri_dish::test_tube:'

b"All of us at Amgen and Amgen Foundation send our deepest sympathies to Dr. Rob Lue\xe2\x80\x99s family and colleagues at @LabXchange and @Harvard. Rob passed away from cancer last week.

Rob was affectionately and respectfully known as the 'Father' of LabXchange, which provided free online science resources and materials to students and teachers around the world.

Science is better off thanks to him and we recommit ourselves to advancing his belief that everyone needs science and science needs everyone.

Dr. Lue spoke with us earlier this year about LabXchange. You can read his interview on Amgen.com. Link in our bio."

b'Cooking at home :woman_cook_medium_skin_tone::woman_cook_dark_skin_tone::woman_cook_medium-light_skin_tone: is a great way to incorporate bone healthy nutrients into your diet. Try adding these #vitaminD-rich\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Salmon Cakes :fish: to your meal plan this\xc2\xa0#WorldOsteoporosisDay. Full recipe below.

Note: While fatty fish like salmon is a good source of vitamin D, you should follow your doctor\xe2\x80\x99s :adult_medium-light_skin_tone:\xe2\x80\x8d:medical_symbol_selector::woman_health_worker_medium-dark_skin_tone: recommendation to be sure you get an adequate daily intake of vitamin D.

Ingredients:
1 lb. fresh Atlantic salmon, skin-on (for a vegetarian friendly option, replace salmon with two 15 oz. cans of black beans)
1 tbsp. + 2 tsp. olive oil, divided
1/2 cup diced onion
1/2 cup diced celery
2 large garlic cloves, minced
1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs
1 large egg
2 green onions, sliced thin and divided
1/2 tsp. dried dill
2 1/2 tsp. Dijon mustard
2 1/2 tbsp. mayo
1/4 tsp. kosher salt
2 tsp. lemon juice

INSTRUCTIONS
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Heat skillet on medium heat and add 1 tsp. of olive oil.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Sprinkle salmon generously with salt and pepper.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Place salmon skin down in hot skillet.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Cook salmon for 4-5 minutes on each side.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Once cooked through, remove from heat and set aside to cool. Heat the same skillet to a medium heat.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Once the pan is hot, add 1 tsp. oil.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Add onion, celery and garlic.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Season with salt.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Sweat the vegetables (turn the heat down if they start to brown) until they\xe2\x80\x99re slightly softened, about 5 minutes. (You still want them to have a little bit of a texture to them.)
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Cool for a minute or two.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Place salmon (or cooked black beans) in mixing bowl and use fork to flake fish apart.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Add the cooled veggies, panko, egg, all but 2 tsp. of the green onion, dill, Dijon, mayo, lemon juice, and 1/4 tsp. salt.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Use a fork to stir the mixture until combined.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Form into four large or eight small patties.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Heat skillet or griddle to a medium heat.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Brush with remaining olive oil.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Add salmon patties, and cook until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per side.
-\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Serve with Cucumber Cooler Dip and garnish with remaining green onion.
Recipe adapted from Cooking For Keeps.'

b'In a drive to understand disease and transform how medicines are discovered, developed, and used, Amgen and its deCODE Genetics subsidiary in Iceland are mining human data at a scale that was once unimaginable.

Amgen and deCODE are studying the genomes of 1.6 million research volunteers. That includes two recent large projects involving a million participants in the UK and US. We\xe2\x80\x99re also diving deeper into the biology of disease through some of the largest proteomics experiments ever conducted. \xc2\xa0

The aim is to apply human data across all aspects of R&D to deliver transformative therapies more quickly to patients. Learn more about the potential of omics to transform R&D.

[Click link in bio to learn more about our groundbreaking work in genetics] #AmgenScience #WeAreBiotech
\xc2\xb7
#genomics #proteomics #transcriptomics #omics #DNA #genetics #drugdiscovery #cancer #science #innovation #STEM #clinicalresearch #healthcare #biotech #discovery'

b'More than six months into\xc2\xa0#covid19, we asked some Amgen scientists and researchers about how they are managing daily life as we all continue to move forward through the pandemic. Go to Amgen.com to read what they had to say about flying on an airplane, going to a movie theater and working out at a gym. Link in profile. #wearebiotech'

b'There\xe2\x80\x99s an ocean of data inside each of us. By diving deep, we can gain insights into diseases and how to predict and prevent them. Analyzing genes (genomics), their expression (transcriptomics), and the resulting proteins (proteomics) can help build a sharper picture of how disease takes root and develops. It\xe2\x80\x99s a field informally known as \xe2\x80\x98omics.\xe2\x80\x99

Amgen and its deCODE Genetics subsidiary are using the power of large-scale human data mining and a multi-omics approach in the quest to find new drug targets, define disease more precisely, identify biomarkers and high-risk patients, and improve clinical trial design.

[Click link in bio to watch the video premiere featuring our latest work in genetics] #AmgenScience #WeAreBiotech
\xc2\xb7
#genomics #proteomics #transcriptomics #omics #DNA #genetics #drugdiscovery #cancer #science #innovation #STEM #clinicalresearch #healthcare #biotech #discovery'

b'Today is #WorldOsteoporosisDay. :globe_showing_Americas:We are working to reduce the incidence of hip and vertebral fractures due to #osteoporosis by 25% by 2025 with our partners @international_osteoporosis, @ucb_biopharma, and The University of Oxford, NDORMS through the IOF #CaptureTheFracture Partnership. :handshake: Together we are implementing post-fracture care coordination programs in hospitals :hospital: and healthcare systems to help patients prevent subsequent fractures due to osteoporosis. #bonehealth #fracture'

b'Do you #KnowFH? A genetic condition called Familial Hypercholesterolemia can be a cause of heart disease and early heart attacks. Your family can be screened for this to make sure you #DontMissABeat.'

b'Lung cancers are among the most common and deadly cancers, accounting for nearly a quarter of all cancer deaths in the U.S. At the same time, there have also been significant advancements in personalized cancer medicine for patients with lung cancer. Cancer researchers have uncovered biomarkers from the lung biopsy samples of patients with lung cancer that can help guide personalized treatment options.\n\n\xe2\x80\x9cBiomarker testing has become a vital part of the treatment decision-making process for patients diagnosed with lung cancer,\xe2\x80\x9d says Byeong Yoon, executive director, platform lead for biomarkers, in Oncology Global Medical Affairs at Amgen.  So, what are biomarkers and how do they impact a patient\xe2\x80\x99s treatment plan? For more info, go to our link in bio and click Amgen news.  #:microscope: #biomarkers #ESMO20 #wearebiotech #lungcancer'

b'The phone you\xe2\x80\x99re holding can predict what you\xe2\x80\x99ll type next. Amgen\xe2\x80\x99s data scientists are developing similar Artificial Intelligence algorithms using electronic health record data to help predict whether a person is at risk of breaking a bone in the next 1-2 years.

Why is this important? Bone breaks due to #osteoporosis can be life-altering. And often, a broken bone is the first sign of osteoporosis.

Crystal Bone, under development, may advance a doctor\xe2\x80\x99s ability to identify a patient\xe2\x80\x99s risk of bone fractures, so they can be clinically evaluated.

Head to the link in our bio to learn more.'

b'Dora Menchaca was a mom, a wife and a scientist here at Amgen. She was also a passenger on Flight 77 that crashed into the Pentagon 19 years ago. Dora was heading home to California after meeting with the U.S. FDA. She was the first member of her Mexican-American family to attend college, eventually earning her PhD in epidemiology from the University of California, Los Angeles. Dora also frequently volunteered at schools where she used her own passion for science to encourage students of color to pursue STEM studies.

We pause today to remember Dora and all the victims from that tragic day. :United_States:
#September11 #neverforget'

b"Has a loved one had a heart attack? Keep your family heart-strong. Talk to your loved ones about how to stay heart-healthy together. Lowering your cholesterol is one of the most important ways to help prevent another heart attack. Here are some tips:

WALK: Get moving, Don't Miss A Beat with your heart health

YOGA: Even light activity can offset serious health risks

SPIN: Moderate to vigorous exercise is best

RUN: Aim for 150+ minutes each week of activity

Don\xe2\x80\x99t Miss A Beat With Your Heart Health.

Get active today. 

#DontMissABeat :heart_suit_selector:"

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s Bob\xe2\x80\x99s annual talk with Amgen\xe2\x80\x99s summer interns! Our CEO Bob Bradway shared advice on navigating life, career and purpose during the time of #covid19. #wearebiotech

Here are five career and life tips he shared:

1.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Don\xe2\x80\x99t wait to make a difference
 \xe2\x80\x9cLife is not a dress rehearsal, and all of us get only one shot\xe2\x80\xa6The greatest lie we tell ourselves is that we have infinite quality time remaining. Get off the starting blocks as fast as you can.\xe2\x80\x9d

2.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Find a position in a company (and industry) doing meaningful work
 \xe2\x80\x9cAt Amgen, we do things every day that really matter, that improve people\xe2\x80\x99s lives. It\xe2\x80\x99s special being associated with a company that has such an important mission.\xe2\x80\x9d

3.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Stay curious and never stop learning
 \xe2\x80\x9cI encourage you all to be lifelong learners. However, much you think you understand, many things will change during your life.\xe2\x80\x9d

4.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Have confidence in yourself
 \xe2\x80\x9cKnowing that other people had confidence in me inspired me to have confidence in myself, and that helped to open new opportunities for me.\xe2\x80\x9d

5.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Don\xe2\x80\x99t be afraid to take on challenges for which you might not be ready
 \xe2\x80\x9cMy predecessor and the Board asked me to take on the job of CEO before I was ready, but one is never fully prepared for such a responsibility. Amgen\xe2\x80\x99s best people are those who perform when they are stretched. All of us do better when we take on responsibilities before we are fully ready for them.\xe2\x80\x9d

Visit Amgen.com to read what other advice he shared during the virtual get-together.'

b'Clarisa shares how the @dempsey_center helped her and her family when she was diagnosed with cancer. Every dollar raised during the #DempseyChallenge supports Clarisa and people like her, who are managing the impact of cancer. To get involved visit dempseychallenge.org. #reimaginethechallenge'

b'Getting a close look at the immune cells that are present in and around a tumor provides invaluable data for cancer research. That\xe2\x80\x99s where single-cell RNA sequencing comes in\xe2\x80\x94it\xe2\x80\x99s a bit like \xe2\x80\x9cStreet View\xe2\x80\x9d on Google Earth, giving a detailed look at what\xe2\x80\x99s going on in a disease.\n\nAmgen\xe2\x80\x99s experience and strong capabilities with this new technology have recently led to a third major publication, in collaboration with @PKU1898, in @CellPress. Using single-cell RNA sequencing, the team studied 50,000 cells from 18 patients with colorectal cancer, seeking to understand immune responses to 2 cancer drugs. Their work identified and provided deep insights into a new subtype of macrophage that developed within tumors. Visit Amgen.com to learn more. #AmgenScience #WeAreBiotech'

b'At Amgen, we put our patients first. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we have partnered with The Dempsey Center, whose mission is to make life better for people managing the impact of cancer. This includes cancer patients, survivors, care partners and family members of all ages. The Dempsey Challenge is an annual run, walk, and cycle experience and is the primary fundraiser for the Dempsey Center.\xc2\xa0This year the Challenge is going virtual.\xc2\xa0

On the weekend of\xc2\xa0September 26\xc2\xa0+ 27 you can join\xc2\xa0@patrickdempsey\xc2\xa0and participate in the Virtual Dempsey Challenge. And ride, run or walk wherever you are in the world. After all, nobody beats cancer alone. It takes a team.\xc2\xa0

Head to\xc2\xa0dempseychallenge.org\xc2\xa0to register and learn more.\xc2\xa0#ReimaginetheChallenge'

b'Many heart failure patients live with a variety of symptoms, including shortness of breath, fatigue and swelling in the legs, ankles and stomach. Read about one patient\xe2\x80\x99s experience during this challenging time and how telemedicine has helped her stay connected to her healthcare providers. Go to Amgen.com for the full story. #covid19 #telemedicine'

b'As the exclusive sponsor of @khanacademy\xe2\x80\x99s #biology content since 2015, Amgen Foundation is looking to the future with a renewed commitment to ensure that everyone, everywhere, has an opportunity to discover the wonders of science.\n\n#science #education #onlinelearning #remotelearning #stemeducation #sciencelearning #educationaccess'

b'What\xe2\x80\x99s happening with immune cells in and around a tumor? Single-cell RNA sequencing is an invaluable new tool in cancer research that can help answer crucial questions such as which cell subtypes are present and which genes are switched on or off.

It\xe2\x80\x99s like a Google Earth \xe2\x80\x9cStreet View\xe2\x80\x9d close-up of the cells in the neighborhood of a tumor. It provides researchers with rich data on the disease environment and the immune system\xe2\x80\x99s response to a given drug.

Along with major cancer studies, we\xe2\x80\x99re utilizing the technology to dive deeper into other diseases areas such as autoimmunity. :dna::microscope:#AmgenScience #WeAreBiotech
\xc2\xb7

b'#ICYMI: The Amgen Foundation has announced a $7.5M commitment to support racial justice and equal opportunity. Funds will be distributed to established national organizations, U.S. communities where Amgen works \xe2\x80\x94 and quality science education partnerships reaching communities of color.\xc2\xa0We are committed to doing our part in this historic fight \xe2\x80\x93 not just through our words, but through our actions. Visit amgen.com to learn more about this news.'

b'Amgen Foundation has announced a $7.5M commitment to support racial justice and equal opportunity. Funds will be distributed to established national organizations, U.S. communities where Amgen works \xe2\x80\x94 and quality science education partnerships reaching communities of color.\xc2\xa0

\xe2\x80\x9cThis commitment supports both the urgent and immediate need to address social inequality and injustice, while also investing in more equitable opportunities for the next generation to be able to excel in science and create meaningful change,\xe2\x80\x9d said Eduardo Cetlin, president of the Amgen Foundation.

\xe2\x80\x9cThis grant from the Amgen Foundation will support @raceforward to catalyze movement building for racial justice, and to work with Black, Indigenous, and other communities of color, institutions, and entire sectors, to build strategies to advance racial justice in our policies, institutions, and culture,\xe2\x80\x9d said Glenn Harris, president of Race Forward.

We are committed to doing our part in this historic fight \xe2\x80\x93 not just through our words, but through our actions. Visit Amgen.com for details about this commitment.'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re gratified Monday\'s U.S. Supreme Court ruling affirmed the U.S. Civil Rights Act of 1964 (which prohibits employment discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex or national origin) also applies to gay and transgender workers.\n\nFrom Amgen General Counsel Jon Graham: "The decision is important because it puts homosexuals and transgender people on equal footing with heterosexual and cisgender people before the law.\xc2\xa0This makes Pride Month even more special this year." From Andy-Edgar-Beltran, who leads Amgen\xe2\x80\x99s PRIDE Employee Resource Group: "I continue to be grateful to work for a company like Amgen that has strong anti-discrimination policies and it is great to know that it is now federal law in the U.S. to include such protections." Visit Amgen.com for the full statement.'

b'Amgen supports #BlackoutTuesday.'

b'CEO Bob Bradway Shares Thoughts on Death of George Floyd: 
If you are feeling shocked, saddened, and outraged by the senseless death of George Floyd in Minneapolis last week, you are not alone. I know all our hearts are aching. If this were an isolated event, it still would be unacceptable. But it is not an isolated event. It is part of a pattern that has become tragically clear in the U.S. and around the world. Equal justice and equal opportunity may be our ideals, but they are not yet our reality.

I\xe2\x80\x99ve talked to many of our African American colleagues over the past few days and have been heartbroken by their stories and struck by how close to home these issues really are. Many of our colleagues feel unable to fulfill their full potential at Amgen and feel unsafe in their neighborhoods solely because of the color of their skin. That\xe2\x80\x99s unacceptable to me and it must change. 
To read the whole letter, please visit link in bio.'

b'Cooking at home is an opportunity to try new recipes. Try adding this calcium rich Cucumber Cooler Dip to your weekly bone healthy meal rotation this #NationalOsteoporosisMonth. Full recipe below.

Ingredients:
1 cup low-fat plain yogurt
1/2 small cucumber, diced
1/4 tsp. lemon zest
1/4 tsp. lemon juice
Pinch of chopped fresh mint
Pinch of salt

Instructions:
Combine yogurt, cucumber, lemon zest and juice, mint and salt in a small bowl or jar. Serve with veggies or atop your choice of protein.

Recipe adapted from\xc2\xa0eatingwell.com

Note: A healthy balanced diet including calcium and vitamin D rich foods can help your bones, but for some women with osteoporosis calcium and vitamin D alone may not be enough.
#osteoporosis #bonehealth #stayhome #WeAreBiotech'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re using human genetics and cutting-edge biology to search for new checkpoint targets that will work in more types of cancer and in more patients. :check_mark::direct_hit: Immune checkpoints act as brakes on the body\xe2\x80\x99s defense cells, ensuring they are deployed only in response to genuine threats and do not harm healthy tissues. But because cancer cells arise from the body\xe2\x80\x99s own tissues, these checkpoints can also prevent immune cells from attacking cancer.

Finding drugs that can inhibit specific immune checkpoints may release the brakes and enable immune cells to attack cancer cells. First-generation checkpoint drugs exist, but for just two pathways so far\xe2\x80\x94CTLA-4 and the PD-1/PD-L1 axis. We\xe2\x80\x99re excited to share our progress in the quest for new checkpoint inhibitors.

#AmgenScience #WeAreBiotech
\xc2\xb7 \xc2\xb7
\xc2\xb7
#immunotherapy #immunecheckpoint #cancer #drugdiscovery #genetics #science #innovation #STEM #clinicalresearch #healthcare #biotech #discovery'

b'#DYK osteoporosis is underdiagnosed in many women? Our #digitalhealth data scientists are collaborating with @UCSF and @theuniversityofsheffield to use #machinelearning to identify at-risk patients existing electronic health records. Much like your phone can predict what word you\xe2\x80\x99re going to type next, through natural language processing we\xe2\x80\x99re able to use past diagnoses to predict the chance of future bone fractures, narrowing the prediction window from 10 years down to 2. #WeAreBiotech #bonehealth'

b'Even while we #stayhome, exercise is important for bone health, especially for those with #osteoporosis. If your doctor agrees, you can try these osteoporosis-friendly yoga poses this #NationalOsteoporosisMonth. :bone: #WeAreBiotech #bonehealth #yoga'
